title: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v5.0 - Hematologic
description: Grades severity of hematologic and lymphatic adverse events from cancer treatment using standardized criteria. Assesses anemia, neutropenia, thrombocytopenia, and other blood disorders according to laboratory values and clinical presentations.

parameters.name: adverse_event_type
parameters.description: Type of hematologic adverse event to grade

parameters.name: hemoglobin
parameters.description: Hemoglobin level (g/dL) - required for anemia grading

parameters.name: neutrophil_count
parameters.description: Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) in cells/mm³ or x10⁹/L - required for neutropenia/febrile neutropenia grading

parameters.name: platelet_count
parameters.description: Platelet count in cells/mm³ or x10⁹/L - required for thrombocytopenia grading

parameters.name: wbc_count
parameters.description: White blood cell count in cells/mm³ or x10⁹/L - required for leukocytosis grading

parameters.name: lymphocyte_count
parameters.description: Absolute lymphocyte count in cells/mm³ or x10⁹/L - required for lymphopenia grading

parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Body temperature in Celsius - required for febrile neutropenia grading

parameters.name: patient_sex
parameters.description: Patient biological sex for determining normal ranges

parameters.name: transfusion_indicated
parameters.description: Whether transfusion is clinically indicated - helps determine anemia grade 3

result.name: ctcae_grade
result.description: CTCAE severity grade (0-5) for the specified adverse event

ranges.interpretation: No adverse event detected. Laboratory values within normal limits for age and sex.
Mild adverse event; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated.
Moderate adverse event; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living.
Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self-care activities of daily living.

references: National Cancer Institute. Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 5.0. Published: November 27, 2017. U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, National Institutes of Health, National Cancer Institute.

Freites-Martinez A, Santana N, Arias-Santiago S, Viera A. Using the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE - Version 5.0) to Evaluate the Severity of Adverse Events of Anticancer Therapies. Actas Dermosifiliogr (Engl Ed). 2021 Feb;112(2):90-92.

Basch E, Reeve BB, Mitchell SA, et al. Development of the National Cancer Institute's patient-reported outcomes version of the common terminology criteria for adverse events (PRO-CTCAE). J Natl Cancer Inst. 2014;106(9):dju244.
formula: Grade assignment based on laboratory values compared to standardized thresholds for each adverse event type according to CTCAE v5.0 criteria
notes: CTCAE v5.0 is the current standard for grading adverse events in cancer clinical trials
Normal ranges may vary by laboratory and patient population; use institutional standards when available
For febrile neutropenia, both neutropenia and fever criteria must be met
Grade 5 (death) requires clinical determination and cannot be assessed by laboratory values alone
Consider patient's baseline values and clinical condition when interpreting grades
This calculator focuses on common hematologic adverse events; full CTCAE includes hundreds of adverse event types
